search.query: index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd component=Metrics group=per_sourcetype_thruput | bin _time span=15m | eval time=_time | eval is_sourcetype=case(sourcetype==lower("$sourcetype$"), "yes", 1=1, "no") | dedup is_sourcetype time | fields is_sourcetype time | mvcombine is_sourcetype | eval send=mvcount(is_sourcetype) | fields time send | sort - time | streamstats reset_on_change=true range(time) as duration by send | eval t=duration/60

panel.html:
This Dashboard displays a cumulative frequency analysis of your data - broken down by index, sourcetype, and host. This dashboard is intended to help you figure out which data you can keep a very close eye on ðŸ‘€
Note: This does not mean that data which doesn't send frequently is not important. It means that if you want to take a "broad stroke" at alerting on missing data, then the data which sends very frequently, is the data you could safely alert on frequently. Conversely, the data which doesn't send very frequently, is not safe to alert on frequently.

Description of panels
(Index, Sourcetype, Host) Frequency: In this panel you'll see a visualization of the "shape" of your data. i.e. How frequent is each (Index, Sourcetype, Host) sending data, and then a percentile line to show where that falls in comparison to the rest of your (Index, Sourcetype, Hosts).
(Index, Sourcetype, Host) Frequency Table: In this panel you'll see a table of the "shape" of your data. This is similar information to the previous panel, but it is clickable. So if you want to further investigate that (Index, Sourcetype, Host) to see how often that specific (Index, Sourcetype, Host) is sending data, you can click on it and see that informatio
(Index, Sourcetype, Host) Frequency Percentile Breakdown: In this panel you'll see a breakdown of where your (Index, Sourcetype, Hosts) frequencies fall in comparison to one another. How many (Index, Sourcetype, Hosts) fall in which percentile group?

search.query: sort - frequency | eventstats p95(frequency) as p95 p75(frequency) as p75 p50(frequency) as p50 p25(frequency) as p25 | eval Percentile = case(frequency >= p95, "95",frequency >= p75, "75",frequency >= p50, "50", frequency >= p25, "25", 1=1, "0") | fields - p*

eventstats p95(frequency) as p95 p75(frequency) as p75 p50(frequency) as p50 p25(frequency) as p25 | eval Percentile = case(frequency >= p95, "95",frequency >= p75, "75",frequency >= p50, "50", frequency >= p25, "25", 1=1, "0") | fields - p* | stats count by Percentile
